intro: Achyronia tridentata, commonly known as the three-toothed dock, is a perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves with three lobes. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters, which are surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Achyronia tridentata has been used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
